review: I bought a Chromecast for $35.00 and that is when the nightmare began.  First I tried to set it up on my PC and was told that the device could not be found.  I repeated this using a Mac Airbook, a Nook and a Kindle witht hte same results.A search of the Internet eventually led to a issue with my Linksys E3000; first the AP feature must be disabled (it was) then since the router is a dual band (24 and 5.0 Ghz) I was directed to give the 2.4 GHz connection the same name as the Chromecast.  Still not working, I found someone who said that by enabling Upnp users to disconnect the Internet connection  - still no go.My Nook and my older Kindle needed to have the updated wireless name configured but still no Chromecast.Best I can tell I will have to acquire an iPad or Android to function as a 'remote' in order to make this work.All in all - 25 thumbs down.I almost forgot, you need to use Google Chrome as your browser for this mess.Final update - I finally gave in and tried my iPhone, even though I don't want to use my phone to watch TV.  I was able to get the APP from Apple but -------- I need to update my iOS to 6.0 or later.  NO WAY!Now I have to decide if I would rather return the Chromecast or SMASH IT WITH A HAMMER!!!!!
author: Ez

Pandora as well, this thing is neat.

review: Kinda' turns the budget LED LCD into an upstairs entertainment center. Just Chromecast Pandora from the tablet it turns on the tv so we can enjoy our favorite music while we make the bed. Or stream Netflix while we ride the exercise bike. Lots of possibilities!
author: eyoreboy

review: I bought the Chromecast with the intention of giving my Roku 2 to my parents. However, due to video lag, dropped casts and the few apps that currently work with Chromecast (and the fact that my parents can't figure out how to use a Roku), I have both devices installed on my tv. I find myself using the Roku about 2x more often. Hopefully once the list of apps and extensions for Chromecast grows, this will not be the case.
